coreCitation.title: Maptivist Data Collection
coreCitation.shortDataDescription: The datasets included as part of the Maptivist Data Collection were created for the purpose of using within the K-12 Maptivist Initiative at the Leventhal Map & Education Center. In Maptivist classrooms, students work with a variety of historical and modern map resources to better understand the past and present of Boston and advocate for change. Students connect with community resources, from individuals working for social justice to City of Boston data sets that enable them to analyze everything from gentrification in their neighborhoods, to health care access by race across the city, to climate resilienceâ€™s relationship to income inequality.
coreCitation.shortGenealogyDescription: Many of the unique datasets included in this collection were created as a result of a larger cartographic project with many moving parts. Details about the data genealogy for each project can be found within that unique dataset's metadata record.
coreCitation.accessCondition: All of the items in this collection, unless otherwise noted, are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This collection was first published in November 2020. The LMEC continually adds datasets to this collection.

description.missingContext: No context was left blank due to unknowns.
